At Dot Transportation, Inc. (DTI), we take driver safety very seriously. Dot drivers rank in the top 20 percent nationally in six of the seven key safety categories and are in the top 35 percent of the other. Most importantly, DTI is an industry leader in lack of personal injury to our drivers.

We have made great strides in reducing speeding over the years. Our SpeedGauge reports have shown immense improvement. Compliance, Safety, Accountability (CSA) moving violations have seen improvement, as well. We are evolving into a safer fleet, as reflected in last year’s record Motor Vehicle Accident (MVA) rate, with a new company-wide record of only 2.65 accidents per million miles.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_image src=”https://drivefordot.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/43903025890_2d91aab026_o.jpg” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”||||||||” header_2_font_size=”25px” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Drive Safe. Get Rewarded.

Our corporate incentive and safety recognition programs have encouraged our drivers to be some of the safest on the road. Plus, DTI is an industry leader when it comes to minimal personal injuries to our drivers. We hold quarterly safety meetings and location-specific programs so our entire team is up to date on the best ways to stay safe on the road.

The Smith System for Driver Safety

We teach drivers the Smith System which is based on the Smith5Keys. These are designed to empower drivers to keep three things at the top of mind:

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Space

Space is required to maneuver your vehicle away from potentially dangerous situations.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Visibility

You need enough visibility to thoroughly scan the area around you and be able to react to potential conflict with other vehicles or objects in time to prevent an accident.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Time

Give yourself adequate time to react to difficult driving environments.

DTI takes your safety seriously.  We expect our drivers to be safe.  We teach the Smith System™ of driver safety and have quarterly safety meetings.  DTI has corporate incentives and recognition for safety, as well as specific programs at each location.

Dot Transportation drivers rank in the top 20% nationally in 6 of the 7 key safety categories and are in the top 35% of the other.  Most importantly, DTI is an industry leader in lack of personal injury to our drivers.
